title: Why do so many small things remind me about things that happened years ago that I have completely forgotten about? - Quora

response.answer_text: That is the beauty of human memory and its random sorting through eons of memory cells like an artificial intelligence computer to show you something new in something you forgot. Pretty damn cool if you ask me.
Everything in our brains is interconnected in some way. There are infinite neural pathways with infinite synapses. The connections just have to be made, the gaps crossed.
